alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Gosper; Harlan; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 14 at 11:24AM CDT until July 14 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT FOR WESTERN PHILLIPS...SOUTHERN PHELPS...SOUTHEASTERN GOSPER...EASTERN FURNAS AND HARLAN COUNTIES... At 1123 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bertrand to Stamford to 7 miles northwest of Almena, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail, with the largest hail mainly confined to southeastern Furnas County. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Orleans around 1130 AM CDT. Holdrege, Alma and Woodruff around 1140 AM CDT. Prairie View around 1145 AM CDT. Ragan and Harlan County Dam around 1150 AM CDT. Huntley around 1155 AM CDT. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
